Granting Access Rights at the Item Level

Although you can set access rights on individual items, this is rarely done. If you really need to allow only one person to see a particular item, you can give one person access rights to that item. However, if object ownership and/or group privileges are not being ignored, the owner of the item and anyone belonging to a group with the correct privileges can still see the item.

To ensure that only that one person can access an item, you would have to stop the server from checking for privileges and ownership. Then the access to every object would be controlled solely by its access rights.

Like folders, items in branched views retain the access rights they had in the parent view until they branch into new objects in the child view.

When you open an <item> Access Rights dialog and select the node for that item, the rights you set apply only to the selected item.

The same rights are also available from the Folder Access Rights dialog, View Access Rights dialog, and Project Access Rights dialog. However, in these cases, the rights cover all items in the selected folder, view, or project, rather than individual items. On the folder, view, and project level, the following container-level access rights are also available:

  • Add item to folder.

  • Share/move out of folder.

  • Change [item] behavior or configuration.

To set item access rights:

  1. Select the folder.

  2. Click a component

  3. Select <component> > Advanced > Item Access  Rights from the menu bar. This action displays a <Item> Access Rights dialog.

  4. Select the [Item] Node.

  5. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  6. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  7. Select the Grant option button. Note: Never select the Deny option button unless you are creating an exception. See Setting Access Rights Exceptions.

  8. Click OK to return to the <Item> Access Rights dialog.

  9. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes for the user or group.

  10. Repeat steps 3-8, as required.

  11. Click OK when you are done.

Item Access Rights

See item and its properties

See this item in the upper pane, and view its properties by selecting <item> > Properties.

Modify properties

Change the properties for this item. The properties that can be modified are different for each type of item. Select <item> > Properties to review the item properties, including its custom properties. If used, an alternate property editor (APE), may restrict the properties that can be modified and the users who can modify them still further.

Delete from folder

Delete this item from its folder.

Change item access rights

Change the access rights for this item. If you change this setting, be sure that you remain on the list of users who can change access rights.

See history

See the history for this item in the History pane.

Perform maintenance

Change the revision comment for past revisions.

Set exclusive locks

Lock the item exclusively.

Break exclusive locks

Remove someone else’s exclusive lock on this item.

Attach/Adjust view labels

Add a view label to this item (change request, requirement, task, or topic). Move a view label from one revision of one item to another. This right controls direct manipulation of view labels for this item at the item level. It does not stop users from attaching a view label to this item when a view label is created.

Detach view labels

Remove a view label from this item. Be aware that, if users can delete view labels, they can detach a view label from this item by deleting the view label from the view, regardless of the setting for this right.

Attach/Adjust revision labels

Add a revision label to this item. Move a revision label from one revision of this item to another. This right controls direct manipulation of revision labels for this item at the item level. It can stop users from checking in items with an attached revision label.

Detach revision labels

Remove a revision label from this item. Be aware that, if users can delete revision labels, they can detach a revision label from this item by deleting the revision label from the view, regardless of the setting for this right.

See links

See the links created for this item.

Create links

Link this item to other items.

Modify links

Change the properties of a link for this item. For example, you have the right to change whether the link’s ends are pinned or floating and to change its description.

Delete links

Delete a link that affects this item.

Check out (files only)

Check out file.

Check in (files only)

Check in file.

Add files (files only)

Add files to a folder, view, or project.  Available only on Folder, View, and Project  Access Rights dialogs.

Create and place in folder (change requests, requirements, tasks, and topics only)

Add items to a folder, view, or project. Available only on Folder, View, and Project  Access Rights dialogs.

Share/Move out of folder

Share items that reside in a folder, view, or project. Available only on Folder, View, and Project  Access Rights dialogs.

Change behavior or configuration

Change the branching ability and configuration of items in a folder, view, or project. Available only on Folder, View, and Project Access Rights dialogs.
